fact: Bananas are berries, but strawberries are not.
The shortest commercial flight in the world lasts just 57 seconds, connecting the islands of Westray and Papa Westray in Scotland.
A day on Venus is longer than a year on Venus due to its slow rotation.
Cleopatra lived closer in time to the first Moon landing than to the construction of the Great Pyramid of Giza.
Wombat poop is cube-shaped, helping it to stay in place and mark territory.
A group of flamingos is called a 'flamboyance'.
The fastest animal on land is the cheetah, capable of running up to 70 mph (113 km/h).
The Eiffel Tower was initially intended to be a temporary exhibit for the 1889 World's Fair.
The Great Wall of China is not a single continuous wall but a series of walls built by different dynasties over time.
The longest living animal is the quahog clam, which can live for over 500 years.
Sharks have been around longer than trees, dating back over 400 million years.
There are more stars in the universe than grains of sand on all of Earth's beaches.
The world's largest snowflake on record was 15 inches wide and 8 inches thick, observed in Montana in 1887.
One light year is approximately 5.88 trillion miles (9.46 trillion kilometers).
The first video game ever created was called 'Tennis for Two' and was made in 1958.
The moon has a distinct smell that astronauts describe as similar to burnt gunpowder.
The human nose can detect about 1 trillion different scents.
The longest river in the world is the Nile, stretching over 4,135 miles (6,650 kilometers).
The word 'nerd' was first coined by Dr. Seuss in 'If I Ran the Zoo' in 1950.
Venus is the hottest planet in our solar system, with temperatures reaching over 900°F (475°C).
The first person to be convicted of speeding was going 8 mph (13 km/h).
The human body contains about 37.2 trillion cells.
An octopus can change color instantly to blend in with its surroundings.
The largest volcano in our solar system is Olympus Mons on Mars, standing about 13.6 miles (22 kilometers) high.
Honeybees can recognize human faces.
The longest recorded flight of a chicken is 13 seconds.
Jellyfish are 95% water and have no brain, heart, or bones.
A single strand of spider silk is stronger than steel of the same thickness.
Mount Everest grows by about 4 millimeters every year due to tectonic activity.
The first successful powered flight was made by the Wright brothers in 1903.
The tallest mountain on Earth is Mauna Kea in Hawaii, which rises over 33,000 feet (10,000 meters) from the ocean floor.
The term 'computer bug' originated when a moth was found trapped in a computer in 1947.
Your body has about 100,000 miles of blood vessels.
The first electric car was built in the 1820s.
The world's largest desert is Antarctica, which is technically a cold desert.
A blue whale's heart weighs about 400 pounds (180 kilograms).
Lightning strikes the Earth about 100 times every second.
The Great Barrier Reef is the largest living structure on Earth.
A person's taste buds have a lifespan of about 10 to 14 days.
The first person to reach the South Pole was Roald Amundsen in 1911.
A giraffe's neck is too short to reach the ground, so it has to spread its legs to drink.
There are more possible iterations of a game of chess than there are atoms in the known universe.
The largest organ in the human body is the skin.
The fastest growing plant is bamboo, which can grow up to 35 inches (90 centimeters) in a single day.
A sneeze can travel at speeds up to 100 miles per hour (160 km/h).
A polar bear's skin is black, even though its fur appears white.
The first human to walk in space was Yuri Gagarin from the Soviet Union in 1961.
An astronaut’s suit costs about $12 million.
Water can boil and freeze at the same time, a phenomenon called the 'triple point.'
The shortest war in history lasted only 38 minutes, between Britain and Zanzibar in 1896.
The largest recorded snowflake was 15 inches wide and 8 inches thick.
The longest living organism on Earth is a colony of Aspen trees in Utah that spans over 80 acres.
The moon is slowly moving away from Earth, about 1.5 inches (3.8 cm) per year.
The word 'computer' originally referred to a person who performed calculations, not a machine.
A group of crows is called a 'murder'.
The first mobile phone call was made by Martin Cooper in 1973.
Sharks can go without eating for weeks due to their slow metabolism.
The longest time someone has survived without water is 18 days.
The Amazon rainforest produces 20% of the world's oxygen supply.
A cat’s nose is as unique as a human’s fingerprint.
The Great Wall of China is not visible from space with the naked eye, despite the myth.
Koalas sleep up to 22 hours a day.
Rats can swim for up to half a mile (800 meters) in open water.
The Eiffel Tower was originally intended to be a temporary structure for the 1889 World’s Fair.
The longest wedding veil was longer than 63 football fields.
A single elephant tooth can weigh up to 6 pounds (2.7 kg).
Venus is the hottest planet in our solar system, even though Mercury is closer to the Sun.
A day on Mercury lasts 59 Earth days.
The first ever photograph taken in space was of the Earth from a V-2 rocket in 1946.
The world's largest snowman was built in Maine in 2008 and stood over 122 feet tall.
The longest hiccuping spree lasted 68 years.
The heart of a blue whale is about the size of a small car.
The word 'robot' comes from the Czech word 'robota', meaning forced labor.
The first recorded use of the word 'science' was in the 14th century.
Cows have best friends and can become stressed when separated from them.
The only letter that doesn't appear in any U.S. state name is Q.
A 'jiffy' is an actual unit of time, meaning 1/100th of a second.
The human brain contains about 86 billion neurons.
You can’t hum while holding your nose.
The strongest muscle in the human body relative to its size is the masseter, the jaw muscle.
Elephants are the only mammals that can’t jump.
An octopus has three hearts and blue blood.
The longest recorded time for a person to hold their breath is 24 minutes and 3 seconds.
The oldest known living organism is a colony of quaking aspens in Utah, estimated to be over 80,000 years old.
The first successful powered airplane flight was 12 seconds long and traveled 120 feet.
The Eiffel Tower grows in height by about 6 inches in the summer due to thermal expansion.
The moon has a distinct smell that astronauts describe as gunpowder-like.
There are more bacteria in your body than there are human cells.
A giraffe’s tongue can be up to 18 inches long.
The first video game character was a dot, created in the game 'Pong' in 1972.
Water makes up about 60% of the human body.
Polar bears have black skin under their white fur.
The longest recorded flight of a chicken lasted 13 seconds.
The first use of the word 'selfie' was in 2002 on an Australian internet forum.
Honey never spoils. Archaeologists have found pots of honey in ancient Egyptian tombs.
The Great Wall of China is over 13,000 miles (21,000 km) long.
The human nose can detect over 1 trillion different scents.
A sloth can hold its breath for up to 40 minutes underwater.
The first man-made object to reach the Moon was the Soviet Union’s Luna 2 in 1959.
The average person will spend about 6 months of their life waiting for red lights to turn green.
